availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Livingston County, Kentucky, farmer. Married to Martha Ann Barnes on August 3, 1837. Father of Mahaley Halstead and Mary Ann Halstead. Married to Sarah Jane Malacia Boyd Halstead on February 17, 1842. Father of Richard P. Halstead, Mildred Halstead, Eliza Halstead, Charles Halstead, and Rebecca Halstead. Justice of the Peace in Livingston County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Livingston County in 1850. Farmer in Livingston County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Livingston County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, p. 324A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston County, p. 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Livingston, Division 3, p. 265B.
